Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: Thou shalt not pervert the justice due to the stranger, or to the fatherless; nor take the widow’s raiment to pledge.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: And a stranger shalt thou not oppress; for ye know the heart of a stranger, seeing ye were strangers in the land of Egypt.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: The sons of the stranger fade away, and come trembling out of their close places.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: And they shall eat those things wherewith atonement was made, to consecrate and to sanctify them; but a stranger shall not eat thereof, because they are holy.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: And if a stranger who is a settler with thee be waxen rich, and thy brother be waxen poor beside him, and sell himself unto the stranger who is a settler with thee, or to the offshoot of a stranger’s family,

Version: The Rashi chumash by Rabbi Shraga Silverstein
Content: The congregation — one statute shall there be for you and for the stranger that sojourns (among you), an everlasting statute unto your generations: As you are, so shall the stranger be, before the L-rd.

Version: The Mishna with Obadiah Bartenura by Rabbi Shraga Silverstein
Content: If there were three brothers, two of them married to two sisters, and one of them married to a stranger — if one of the sisters' husbands died, and the one married to the stranger took his wife (in

Version: The Mishna with Obadiah Bartenura by Rabbi Shraga Silverstein
Content: If there were three brothers, two of them married to two sisters, and one of them married to a stranger [i.e., kin to neither of the wives] — if one of the sisters' husbands died, and the one

Version: The Rashi Ketuvim by Rabbi Shraga Silverstein
Content: Let another praise you, and not your [own] mouth; a stranger, and not your [own] lips.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: Unto whom alone the land was given, And no stranger passed among them.

Version: The Targum of Jonathan ben Uzziel, trans. J. W. Etheridge, London, 1862
Content: A sojourner or a hired stranger shall not eat thereof.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: And if a stranger sojourn with thee in your land, ye shall not do him wrong.

Version: Eliyahu Munk, HaChut Hameshulash
Content: נשיא אלוהים, “a prince of G’d,” neither stranger or resident stranger as Avraham had described himself.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: and her two sons; of whom the name of the one was Gershom; for he said: ‘I have been a stranger in a strange land’;

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: Ye shall have one manner of law, as well for the stranger, as for the home-born; for I am the LORD your God.’

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: My son, if thou art become surety for thy neighbour, If thou hast struck thy hands for a stranger—

Version: The Targum of Jonathan ben Uzziel, trans. J. W. Etheridge, London, 1862
Content: Have pity then (yourselves) upon the stranger, for you were strangers in the land of Mizraim.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: And thou shalt rejoice in thy feast, thou, and thy son, and thy daughter, and thy man-servant, and thy maid-servant, and the Levite, and the stranger, and the fatherless, and the widow, that are within thy gates.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: The heart knoweth its own bitterness; And with its joy no stranger can intermeddle.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: Thou shalt not abhor an Edomite, for he is thy brother; thou shalt not abhor an Egyptian, because thou wast a stranger in his land.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: Love ye therefore the stranger; for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: And a stranger shalt thou not wrong, neither shalt thou oppress him; for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt.
